This guide will walk you through setting up automated alerts on TradingView, helping you streamline your trading process and save time.

Getting Started

Visit TradingView and open a chart from the Product -> Supercharts section. To automate your alerts, use a strategy or indicator that supports built-in alerts. We recommend the IsAlgo strategy for its integrated alert system.

Step 1: Configure Your Chart

1. Select the Asset: Choose the asset to trade (e.g., BTCUSD, NAS100) and ensure the correct timeframe is displayed.

2. Add the Strategy: Apply your strategy to the chart. Test it thoroughly before automating your alerts.

Step 2: Writing Alerts

Alerts require specific inputs. Here’s how to structure them:

Entry Alerts

Inputs for entry alerts:
• D: Direction (Buy or Sell)
• A: Asset name (e.g., BTCUSD, NAS100)
• V: Volume or trade amount
• ID: Trade ID (use {{ "{{ID}" }}} with IsAlgo)

Example Entry Alerts:
• Long: D=Buy A=BTCUSD V=10 ID={{ "{{ID}" }}}
• Short: D=Sell A=BTCUSD V=10 ID={{ "{{ID}" }}}

Exit Alerts

Inputs for exit alerts:
• X: Trade type to exit (Buy or Sell)
• A: Asset name
• P: Partial close percentage (use {{ "{{partial_close}" }}} with IsAlgo)
• ID: Trade ID (use {{ "{{ID}" }}} with IsAlgo)

Example Exit Alerts:
• Long Exit: X=Buy A=BTCUSD P={{ "{{partial_close}" }}} ID={{ "{{ID}" }}}
• Short Exit: X=Sell A=BTCUSD P={{ "{{partial_close}" }}} ID={{ "{{ID}" }}}

Step 3: Paste Alerts

If using IsAlgo, paste the alert messages into the relevant input fields: Entry Long, Entry Short, Exit Long, Exit Short. Click OK to save.

Step 4: Create a TradingView Alert

To create a TradingView alert:

  1. Click the Alert icon (bell) in the chart toolbar.
  2. Select Create Alert.
  3. In Condition, choose your strategy/indicator and select alert() function calls only.
  4. Give the alert a descriptive name.
  5. Go to the Notifications tab, enable Webhook URL, and paste your Webhook URL.
  6. Click Create.

Note: Alerts are tied to the current asset and timeframe. Changing these or modifying strategy inputs requires recreating the alert.
